reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Farming and Fishing Industries Development Act
reg:regulation.reg:title:
Grain Industry
Development Fund Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 155/2017, August 1, 2017]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: council means the British Columbia Peace River Grain Industry Development Council continued under the Farming and Fishing Industries Development Act;
first receiver means any person who receives grain from, or on behalf of, a grain producer for the purpose of packing, grading, storing, shipping, selling, distributing, processing or feeding;
grain includes all grains, oilseeds, forage seeds and pulse crops grown by a grain producer within the Peace River Regional District;
grain producer means a person who grows grain.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The grain producer shall pay the levy to the first receiver when the grain is delivered to the first receiver.
The first receiver shall act as the agent of the council in collecting the levy and shall

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deduct the levy from the proceeds otherwise due to the grain producer for the delivered grain, and
pay to the council the amount collected for the levy less any collection fees agreed upon between the first receiver and the council.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A first receiver who collects a levy must do both of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: keep records respecting the collection of a levy under this section for at least 2 years after the date the levy must be remitted to the council;
make the records referred to in paragraph (a) available for inspection under section 6 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 5 of the Act, a refund of a levy is permitted in the amount calculated in accordance with subsection (2) of this section.
The council must refund to a grain producer an amount equalling the amount of the levy less the sum of the collection fees referred to in section 2 (4) of this regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A refund is payable on receipt by the council of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an application from a grain producer in accordance with section 5 of the Act, and
verification of the payment of a levy by the grain producer in accordance with section 2 (3) of this regulation in the form of copies of bills of sale or other information approved by the council.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Farming and Fishing Industries Development Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 134, sections 5 and 10]
